verbose_text: The dlDF curves in Figure XREF_FIG also show that substitution of two hydrogen atoms in the ammonia dimer by methyl groups 1) increases the steepness of the repulsive branch of the dlDF energy curve, 2) decreases the depth of the potential well, and 3) shifts the position of the minimum to larger distances.
evidence: hydrogen atoms in the ammonia dimer by methyl groups 1) increases the steepness of the repulsive branch of the dlDF energy curve
